content.title: AICTE-SHORT TERM TRAINING PROGRAMME (STTP) (UT-J&K,LADAKH AND NER)
content.state: Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, North-Eastern Region
content.beneficiary: Faculty members in the field of technical education
content.details: Short Term Training Program (STTP) in North-Eastern Region (NER) and UTs of J&K and Ladakh intends to conduct faculty trainings through financial assistance from AICTE to enable faculty members in the field of technical education introspect learn techniques that can help prepare students for active and successful participants in a knowledge society. It is a residential programme of six days. The approved STTP shall be conducted within six months from the date of release of funds.
benefits: Funding to Institutions: ₹5,00,000/- to the host University/Institution for conducting the training for the academic year.
Disbursement of the Funds: The full amount of the grant sanctioned shall be released as advance to the University/Institution.
Training to Teachers/Staffs: Faculty training in the field of technical education with various types including pedagogical training and subject-related training.
eligibility: For Faculty: All teachers, supporting technical and administrative staff in areas of technical education.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Registration of New Institute involves several steps including visiting the AICTE portal, logging in, and submitting the application.
documents_required: Original Statement of actual expenditure & Utilization Certificate.
Feedback form in the prescribed proforma.
Copy of the proceedings and completion report.
Duly filled application form for teachers.
Curriculum vitae highlighting relevant teaching experience and qualifications.
Statement of purpose explaining your interest in the chosen STTP topic.
Recommendation letter from the Head of Department or Principal.

faqs.question: What is AICTE-STTP scheme?
faqs.answer: Short Term Training Program (STTP) intends to conduct faculty training through financial assistance from AICTE to enable faculty members in the field of technical education in North-Eastern Region (NER) and UTs of J&K and Ladakh.

faqs.question: Who manages this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by All India Council for Technical Education(AICTE).

faqs.question: Mention one of the main benefits of the scheme.
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the host institution.

faqs.question: What should be the criteria of the institution?
Who shall assess the proposal?
faqs.answer: Each proposal shall be assessed by an expert committee consisting of three members.

faqs.question: Does the participant will get any certificate?
faqs.answer: A test to be conducted at the end of the Programme and a certificate to be issued to only those participants who attended the Programme and qualified in the test.

faqs.question: Is there any restriction for the participants from the host institution?
faqs.answer: Not more than 02 participants shall be from the host institution/group of institutions.

faqs.question: How the application will be submitted?
faqs.answer: Host institutions need to submit online applications.
